unnormalised: The auto-rickshaw sputtered to a halt outside what looked like a promisingly colourful building. I double-checked the address on my phone: 12B, Nehru Marg, Jaipur, Rajasthan, 302001. Yep, that was it. “Hotel Raj Palace,” a somewhat faded sign proclaimed. After a long train journey from Delhi (16 hours, to be exact!), I was desperate to finally reach my destination.
normalised: The auto-rickshaw sputtered to a halt outside what looked like a promisingly colourful building. I double-checked the address on my phone: twelve B, Nehru Marg, Jaipur, Rajasthan, three hundred and two thousand and one. Yep, that was it. “Hotel Raj Palace,” a somewhat faded sign proclaimed. After a long train journey from Delhi (sixteen hours, to be exact!), I was desperate to finally reach my destination.

unnormalised: The lobby was surprisingly grand, with marble floors and a giant portrait of what I assumed was a former Maharaja. A young man in a crisp uniform greeted me. “Namaste! Welcome to Hotel Raj Palace. Do you have a reservation, Madam?”
normalised: The lobby was surprisingly grand, with marble floors and a giant portrait of what I assumed was a former Maharaja. A young man in a crisp uniform greeted me. “Namaste! Welcome to Hotel Raj Palace. Do you have a reservation, Madam?”

unnormalised: “Yes,” I replied, a little too eagerly. “Under the name Sharma, Priya Sharma. Booking ID JP24789.” He tapped away at his computer for a moment. “Ah, yes, Ms. Sharma. A deluxe room booked for 3 nights, starting today, the 24/10/2024.”
normalised: “Yes,” I replied, a little too eagerly. “Under the name Sharma, Priya Sharma. Booking I-D J-P two four seven eight nine.” He tapped away at his computer for a moment. “Ah, yes, Ms. Sharma. A deluxe room booked for three nights, starting today, the twenty fourth october two thousand and twenty four.”

unnormalised: He handed me a registration form. “Please fill this out, and I’ll get your key ready. Your room is on the 3rd floor, room number 305. Elevator is just around the corner." My current address was 45, Linking Road, Bandra West, Mumbai, Maharashtra, 400050. Filling it out felt good; it was the last step before I could finally relax.
normalised: He handed me a registration form. “Please fill this out, and I’ll get your key ready. Your room is on the third floor, room number three hundred and five. Elevator is just around the corner." My current address was forty five, Linking Road, Bandra West, Mumbai, Maharashtra, four hundred thousand and fifty. Filling it out felt good; it was the last step before I could finally relax.

unnormalised: Finding my room was easy enough, though the elevator was definitely showing its age. Room 305 turned out to be even better than the pictures online. A spacious room, with a small balcony overlooking a bustling street. The attached bathroom had a sign stating "Geyser available 24x7", which was definitely a plus. The hotel also had a rooftop restaurant, with a fantastic view of the city, located at the top of the building on floor 9. The address of the restaurant, conveniently printed on a menu in my room, was: Rooftop Restaurant, Hotel Raj Palace, 12B, Nehru Marg, Jaipur, Rajasthan, 302001.
normalised: Finding my room was easy enough, though the elevator was definitely showing its age. Room three hundred and five turned out to be even better than the pictures online. A spacious room, with a small balcony overlooking a bustling street. The attached bathroom had a sign stating "Geyser available twenty four by seven", which was definitely a plus. The hotel also had a rooftop restaurant, with a fantastic view of the city, located at the top of the building on floor nine. The address of the restaurant, conveniently printed on a menu in my room, was: Rooftop Restaurant, Hotel Raj Palace, twelve B, Nehru Marg, Jaipur, Rajasthan, three hundred and two thousand and one.

unnormalised: After freshening up, I decided to explore the neighborhood a bit. Nehru Marg was a lively street, packed with shops selling everything from colourful sarees to handicrafts. I even found a charming little chai stall at the corner of Nehru Marg and MI Road, Address: Corner Chai Stall, Nehru Marg & MI Road Junction, Jaipur, Rajasthan, 302001.
normalised: After freshening up, I decided to explore the neighborhood a bit. Nehru Marg was a lively street, packed with shops selling everything from colourful sarees to handicrafts. I even found a charming little chai stall at the corner of Nehru Marg and M-I Road, Address: Corner Chai Stall, Nehru Marg and M-I Road Junction, Jaipur, Rajasthan, three hundred and two thousand and one.

unnormalised: The location of the hotel, 12B, Nehru Marg, Jaipur, Rajasthan, 302001 proved to be perfect for sightseeing. Hawa Mahal was just a short auto-rickshaw ride away, and the City Palace was easily accessible by bus. The postal code 302001 seemed to be ubiquitous; every shop, every business proudly displayed it as part of their address.
normalised: The location of the hotel, twelve B, Nehru Marg, Jaipur, Rajasthan, three hundred and two thousand and one proved to be perfect for sightseeing. Hawa Mahal was just a short auto-rickshaw ride away, and the City Palace was easily accessible by bus. The postal code three hundred and two thousand and one seemed to be ubiquitous; every shop, every business proudly displayed it as part of their address.

unnormalised: My stay at Hotel Raj Palace, 12B, Nehru Marg, Jaipur, Rajasthan, 302001, turned out to be exactly what I needed: a comfortable and conveniently located base from which to explore the Pink City. And I was very thankful I booked my stay a month in advance, knowing the Diwali rush was coming. Finding a decent place in Jaipur during Diwali, especially with the chaos of booking trains, can be a real headache.
normalised: My stay at Hotel Raj Palace, twelve B, Nehru Marg, Jaipur, Rajasthan, three hundred and two thousand and one, turned out to be exactly what I needed: a comfortable and conveniently located base from which to explore the Pink City. And I was very thankful I booked my stay a month in advance, knowing the Diwali rush was coming. Finding a decent place in Jaipur during Diwali, especially with the chaos of booking trains, can be a real headache.
